items.title: Saudi Arabia’s Return to Washington
items.summary: David Sanger, a White House and national security correspondent, describes how the crown prince of Saudi Arabia, a pariah after the killing of Jamal Khashoggi, has become a dealmaker in Washington.

items.title: Trump Says He Will Approve the Epstein Files Release, but Some May Be Withheld
items.summary: The bill has not yet been presented to the president, and it wasn’t clear when it might reach his desk.

items.title: F.B.I. Trainee Sues After Being Abruptly Fired Over Display of Gay Pride Flag
items.summary: He described his dismissal as the latest move by senior F.B.I. officials to play politics, damaging morale and hindering the bureau’s ability to carry out its public safety mission.

items.title: White House Nominates Consumer Bureau Director Amid Efforts to Shut Agency
items.summary: The nomination was a tactical move that will extend Russell T. Vought’s time as acting director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

items.title: Tom Steyer Will Run for California Governor in 2026 Race
items.summary: Tom Steyer, who ran for president in 2020 and funded an effort to impeach President Trump, will join the crowded field trying to succeed Gov. Gavin Newsom.

items.title: Trump’s Tariffs Sent Trade Plummeting in August
items.summary: The steep tariffs President Trump issued in August led to a contraction in imports and the trade deficit, newly released data shows.

items.title: Justice department will release Epstein files within 30 days, says US attorney general – US politics live
items.summary: <p>Pam Bondi speaks after US Senate passes bill to release files – but agency may hold back material that could affect a Trump-ordered investigation</p><p>One quick note, <strong>there haven’t been any changes to Donald Trump’s schedule today, per the press pool</strong>. Which means, as of now, the president doesn’t have any time allotted to sign the bill forcing the justice department to release the full batch of Jeffrey Epstein files.</p><p>We’ll keep you updated if things change throughout the day.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/19/us-congress-epstein-files-donald-trump-saudi-arabia-redistricting-latest-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Were you affected by the Palisades fire in Los Angeles? We would like to hear from you
items.summary: <p>We would like to speak to people who lost their homes in the wildfire and learn how they’re preparing for the holidays</p><p>The Pacific Palisades fire – the<a href="https://www.wildfirela.org/history/"> most destructive</a> in Los Angeles history – killed 12 people and destroyed more than 6,800 structures earlier this year, turning swaths of <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/jan/09/california-wildfires-pacific-palisades-los-angeles">western Los Angeles into a wasteland</a>.</p><p>We would like to speak to people who lost their homes in the wildfire and learn how they are approaching the upcoming holiday season.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/19/pacific-palisades-wildfires-los-angeles">Continue reading...</a>
